questions_and_answers.question: What is the mission of the UM Library?
questions_and_answers.answer: The mission of the UM Library is to provide professional expertise, diverse information resources, and knowledge-based services.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the main libraries in the UM Library Network?
questions_and_answers.answer: The main libraries in the UM Library Network include the Central Library, Za’ba Memorial Library, T.J Danaraj Medical Library, and Ahmad Ibrahim Law Library.

questions_and_answers.question: What are some of the branch libraries available?
questions_and_answers.answer: Branch libraries include the Built Environment, Dentistry, Education, East Asian Studies, Engineering, Indian Studies, Islamic Studies, Languages and Linguistics, and Malay Studies libraries.

questions_and_answers.question: What types of collections does the UM Library have?
questions_and_answers.answer: The UM Library has a variety of collections including monographs, bound journals, institutional repositories, e-books, e-theses & dissertations, electronic (online) databases, microfilms, microfiches, and the Academic Reserve Collection.

questions_and_answers.question: What is the Pendeta Discovery system?
questions_and_answers.answer: Pendeta Discovery is an online search tool for the UM Library where you can search the library collection, check new books, manage your library account, renew books online, and make book reservations. It can be accessed at http://www.pendeta.um.edu.my.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the borrowing procedures at the UM Library?
questions_and_answers.answer: You are responsible for all materials you borrow. Do not pass items to another person. Use the self-check machine to borrow books and print out your receipts.

questions_and_answers.question: How can I access the A-Z Database of the UM Library?
questions_and_answers.answer: The A-Z Database, which provides access to more than 100,000 subject-based web links to online databases, e-journals, e-books, and selected web resources, can be accessed at https://umlibguides.um.edu.my/az.php.

questions_and_answers.question: What e-services are provided by the UM Library's new online platform?
questions_and_answers.answer: The UM Library's new online platform provides e-services such as Publication Supply, Collection Suggestions, Books on Approval, and access to UM’s past examination papers.

questions_and_answers.question: What research skills assistance does the UM Library offer?
questions_and_answers.answer: The UM Library offers research skills assistance through workshops, information searching, LibGuide, resource tools & platforms, citation & referencing, online sessions, embedded librarianship, university & elective courses, and evidence-based medicine.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the UM Library's social media channels?
questions_and_answers.answer: The UM Library's social media channels include Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/UMalayaLibrary), a blog (https://blogumlib.com), Twitter (https://twitter.com/unimalayalib), Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/umlib/?hl=en), and TikTok (http://www.tiktok.com/@umlib).

questions_and_answers.question: What are the library hours during the semester?
questions_and_answers.answer: During the semester, the UM Library is open Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm, and on Saturday and Sunday from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm. The library is closed on public holidays.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the library hours during the revision and examination weeks?
questions_and_answers.answer: During the revision and examination weeks, the UM Library is open Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 11:30 pm, and on Saturday and Sunday from 9:00 am to 11:30 pm. The library is closed on public holidays.

questions_and_answers.question: What are the library hours during the long semester break?
questions_and_answers.answer: During the long semester break, the UM Library is open Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 6:30 pm, and on Saturday and Sunday from 9:00 am to 4:00 pm. The library is closed on public holidays.
